answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Frances – I hope the following is helpful:
Brainstorming
http://writingcenter.unc.edu/handouts/brainstorming/
5 Effective Brainstorming Exercises
http://dudye.com/5-effective-brainstorming-exercises
7 Ways to Enliven Your Next Brainstorming Session
http://www.forbes.com/sites/thesba/2013/03/18/7-ways-to-enliven-your-next-brainstorming-session/
BRAINSTORMING SESSION ICEBREAKERS
http://creativethinking.net/articles/2012/04/17/brainstorming-session-icebreakers/
Pamela Muse
West Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org 
888-468-6450

answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Frances, 
Here are two resources that will help you get some brainstorming going and improve the creativity in your meetings. I hope you find these useful and that others jump in and share their tips and advice. 
-Using SWOT Analysis, a case study that helps employees brainstorm and become more engaged in activities. https://icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/20395
-This previously asked question on standing meetings discusses how they can help bring about more creative ideas. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/kn/Question/22890
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Frances Adams-O'Brien
text: We are looking for a fun and effective process (one and done) for a brainstorming session for a diverse group of about 10 people. I know there is voluminous information "out there" on the topic but knowing that there are a lot of great innovators in the Alliance, I wanted to see what methods are being used to generate ideas and narrow the ideas discovered to a workable list.
title: Brainstorming methods/process
